thread.title: Ohio toddler Rainn Peterson missing since Friday found safe in woods
thread.title_full: Ohio toddler Rainn Peterson missing since Friday found safe in woods | NOLA.com

author: Associated Press
title: Ohio toddler Rainn Peterson missing since Friday found safe in woods
text:
NORTH BLOOMFIELD, Ohio â€” A 2-year-old girl who disappeared Friday night from her great-grandparents' house was found alive Sunday evening in a wooded area, Cleveland.com reports.
Authorities found Rainn Peterson not far from where she had been reported missing. The area is near the community of North Bloomfield, just north of Warren and Youngstown near the Pennsylvania state line.
Rainn was being taken to a hospital for evaluation. Officials had no other immediate information on how she disappeared or how she was discovered.
Searchers on horseback had combed through fields while a helicopter hovered above Sunday in the hunt for Rainn. Authorities concentrated the search around the home in rural northeastern Ohio, going through wooded areas, backyards and drainage pipes.
Trumbull County Sheriff Tom Altiere said early Sunday, before Rainn was found, that there were no signs of foul play. Deputies had searched the family's home several times and had given polygraph tests to the little girl's relatives, he said.
Search dogs on Saturday briefly picked up the 2-year-old girl's scent just down the street from where she was last seen, the sheriff said.
Rainn and her two brothers, ages 3 and 4, were staying with their great-grandparents on Friday when they reported her missing.
Rainn's mother said her children had been staying with the couple because she was moving into an apartment.
Her grandmother was in the kitchen and the three children were with the grandfather in another area of the house when the toddler walked away and soon after was missing, Brandi Peterson said.
"She's 2 years old and goes to strangers. She goes to anybody. She is just an innocent little girl, and she is lost, and I don't know if she is cold or hungry," Peterson told WFMJ-TV in Youngstown before her daughter was found.
The sheriff said the family had cooperated with investigators and there were no signs of violence at the home.
